our_candidate.name: Sarah Holloway
our_candidate.background: Former state Attorney General, grew up in Oakland County suburbs, prosecuted Flint water crisis cases, first-time gubernatorial candidate

opponent.name: Rick Vanderberg
opponent.background: One-term governor, former CEO of West Michigan manufacturing company, Grand Rapids native

key_constituencies: Black voters in Detroit and Flint
demographics.economic_profile: Manufacturing legacy with auto industry decline, some tech growth in Ann Arbor corridor, significant rural-urban divide

notes: Abortion emerged as decisive issue post-Dobbs, particularly with suburban women. Economic messaging required specifics to land - generic populism underperformed. Crime attacks from opponent resonated more than expected in suburbs. Candidate's AG background provided credibility but low initial name ID was a challenge. Rural Northern Michigan focus group revealed deep sense of abandonment and cultural alienation - generic Democratic messaging failed completely (1.75/5) while rural-specific messaging performed better (3.25/5). Rural outreach remains a gap for future campaigns.
